text.0: waken the aśvin pair who yoke their car at early morn may they.
text.1: approach to drink this soma juice.
text.2: we call the aśvins twain the gods borne in a noble car the best.
text.3: of charioteers who reach the heavens.
text.4: dropping with honey is your whip aśvins and full of pleasantness.
text.6: as ye go thither in your car not far o aśvins is the home.
text.7: of him who offers soma juice.
text.8: for my protection i invoke the goldenhanded savitar.
text.9: he knoweth as a god the place.
text.10: that he may send us succour praise the waters offspring savitar.
text.11: fain are we for his holy ways.
text.12: we call on him distributer of wondrous bounty and of wealth.
text.13: on savitar who looks on men.
text.14: come hither friends and seat yourselves savitar to be praised by us.
text.16: o agni hither bring to us the willing spouses of the gods.
text.17: and tvaṣṭar to the soma draught.
text.18: most youthful agni hither bring their spouses hotrā bhāratī.
text.20: spouses of heroes goddesses with whole wings may they come to us.
text.21: with great protection and with aid.
text.22: indrāṇī varuṇānī and agnāyī hither i invite.
text.23: for weal to drink the soma juice.
text.24: may heaven and earth the mighty pair bedew for us our sacrifice.
text.25: and feed us full with nourishments.
text.26: their water rich with fatness there in the gandharvas steadfast place.
text.27: the singers taste through sacred songs.
text.28: thornless be thou o earth spread wide before us for a dwellingplace.
text.29: vouchsafe us shelter broad and sure.
text.30: the gods be gracious unto us even from the place whence viṣṇu strode.
text.31: through the seven regions of the earth.
text.32: through all this world strode viṣṇu thrice his foot he planted and the whole.
text.33: was gathered in his footsteps dust.
text.34: viṣṇu the guardian he whom none deceiveth made three steps thenceforth.
text.36: look ye on viṣṇus works whereby the friend of indra closeallied.
text.37: hath let his holy ways be seen.
text.38: the princes evermore behold that loftiest place where viṣṇu is.
text.39: laid as it were an eye in heaven.
text.40: this viṣṇus station most sublime the singers ever vigilant.
text.41: lovers of holy song light up.
